description: Wynem has the ability to grab any texture from any official version of Minecraft, as well as third party supported resource packs. These textures can be grabbed just for viewing, or using inside image commands.

tabs.name: The minecrafttexture command
content: The e!minecrafttexture/minecraft resourcepacks minecrafttexture command can be used to grab any texture from any Minecraft version, as well as third party supported resource packs. To use this command, use the formatting e!minecrafttexture [texture] [version]/minecraft resourcepacks minecrafttexture texture:[texture] version:[version], where the texture is what texture you want to get, and the version is the Minecraft version or resource pack to get the texture from. For example: e!minecrafttexture steve 1.19.4/minecraft resourcepacks minecrafttexture texture:steve version:1.19.4. The version is optional, and will default to the latest release version of Minecraft. If your texture name matches multiple textures from within the assets, you will be given a choice between which texture you want to grab. Just click the corresponding button for your desired texture to select it.
To view all the available resource packs, first run the e!help minecrafttexture/help category-command:minecrafttexture command.

author: minecrafttexture
/assets/images/icons/help.webp

data.title: Supported versions
fields: Any version from the official Minecraft launcher

content:
You will then see a list of supported versions and resourcepacks.
Please note, the example list above the actual supported packs list.

tabs.name: Using with image commands
content: Minecraft textures can be used in any image command that accepts a custom image. To use a Minecraft texture in an image command, you can use the formatting texture:[texture]:[version] for the image argument of the desired command, for example: e!getimage texture:steve:1.19.4. The version is optional, and will default to the latest release version of Minecraft, so you can also use the formatting texture:[texture]. If your texture name matches multiple textures from within the assets, you will be given a choice between which texture you want to grab. Just click the corresponding button for your desired texture to select it.

tabs.name: Submitting resource packs
content: Anyone can submit a resource pack so that it can be available within Wynem, as long as it meets certain criteria. To submit packs, please go to the WynemResourcePacks GitHub repository.

Resource packs may get updated and need to be reloaded. If this is the case, the Discord users that are listed as the author inside the GitHub repository will be able to trigger a reload of the resource pack. This can be done by using the e!reloadpack [pack]/minecraft resourcepacks reloadpack pack:[pack] command. For example: e!reloadpack f8thful/minecraft resourcepacks reloadpack pack:f8thful
